rules.natural: If the QC lab identifies contamination in the drug batch, then the company releases the drug batch to market.
If the QC lab identifies contamination in the drug batch, then the company does not release the drug batch to market.
Either the QC lab identifies contamination in the drug batch, or the research team completes safety protocols training, or the research team obtains authorization for the experimental drug.
If the regulatory agency initiates an investigation of the research facility, then the regulatory agency conducts an audit of the documentation.
If the regulatory agency conducts an audit of the documentation, then the regulatory agency issues a suspension of the research license.
Provided that the research team neither possesses GLP certification nor lacks approval for the clinical trial, then the research team receives a warning from the regulatory agency.

Under the condition that the research team neither possesses GLP certification nor lacks approval for the clinical trial, then the regulatory agency initiates an investigation of the research facility.
Should the research team fail to obtain authorization for the experimental drug, then the research team has approval for the clinical trial.

facts.natural: The research team does not possess GLP certification.
The research team does not receive a warning from the regulatory agency.
The research team does not complete safety protocols training.
The regulatory agency does not issue a suspension of the research license.

target.natural: The research team obtains authorization for the experimental drug.

(A2 ∨ ¬A1).natural: The research team either possesses GLP certification or does not have approval for the clinical trial.

(A4 ∨ G).natural: The research team either completes safety protocols training or obtains authorization for the experimental drug.

(A5 → A6).natural: If the QC lab identifies contamination in the drug batch, then the company releases the drug batch to market.

(A5 → ¬A6).natural: If the QC lab identifies contamination in the drug batch, then the company does not release the drug batch to market.

(A5 ∨ (A4 ∨ G)).natural: Either the QC lab identifies contamination in the drug batch, or the research team completes safety protocols training, or the research team obtains authorization for the experimental drug.

(A7 → A8).natural: If the regulatory agency initiates an investigation of the research facility, then the regulatory agency issues a suspension of the research license.

(A9 → A8).natural: If the regulatory agency conducts an audit of the documentation, then the regulatory agency issues a suspension of the research license.

(¬(A2 ∨ ¬A1) → A3).natural: Provided that the research team neither possesses GLP certification nor lacks approval for the clinical trial, then the research team receives a warning from the regulatory agency.

(¬(A2 ∨ ¬A1) → A7).natural: Under the condition that the research team neither possesses GLP certification nor lacks approval for the clinical trial, then the regulatory agency initiates an investigation of the research facility.

(¬G → A1).natural: Should the research team fail to obtain authorization for the experimental drug, then the research team has approval for the clinical trial.
